message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.CE 

The paper proposes a modified Thompson Sampling algorithm to solve the bid optimization problem faced by advertisers in real-time bidding. This involves learning the optimal bidding policy and estimating the expected effect of displaying the ad. The paper uses economic theory to frame the problem as a multi-armed bandit problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as the paper deals with optimization and learning. The paper also involves economic theory, which suggests cs.CE (Computational Economics) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a modified Thompson Sampling algorithm, which is a popular algorithm in the field of multi-armed bandits, suggesting cs.MA (Multi-Agent Systems) as another possible sub-category.
